quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Mate and Capital
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, smith. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who was the first mate of the fictional USS Stingray, commanded by Lieutenant Commander Thomas Dodge?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Martin T. Pascal

questions.question: The French Foreign Legion was formed in 1831 to conquer which nation ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Algeria

questions.question: The proteins in dead organisms as well as in body wastes are converted into ammonia by bacteria and fungi. Into what useful product do other bacteria convert this ammonia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nitrates

questions.question: What is the capital city of Bahrain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Manama

questions.question: Who is Captain Quints first mate on the Orca?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Matt Hooper

questions.question: David E. Weiss was the first mate of the SS Edmund Fitzgerald. The Captain was Ernest M. McSorley.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who was the first mate of PT-73, that was commanded by Lieutenant Commander Quinton McHale?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ensign Charles Parker

questions.question: Who was Captain James T. Kirks first mate on the USS Enterprise NCC-1701?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mr. Spock

questions.question: Since its separation from the Roman Catholic church in 1534, this branch of Christianity acts as a mother branch of the worldwide Anglican Communion.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Church of  England

questions.question: Which of the three classical types of columns has its capital ornately decorated to look like acanthus leaves?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Corinthian

questions.question: Captain Edward J. Smith was captain of Titanic. Who was the first officer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William McMaster Murdoch

questions.question: Which of the following languages is spoken as primary language by the most people?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bengali

questions.question: Almaty, or Alma-Ata as formerly known, is the largest city and capital of which country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kazakhstan

questions.question: The motto of which US state is The Welfare of the People Shall Be The Supreme Law.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Missouri

questions.question: The fictional USS Echo was commanded by Lieutenant Rip Crandall. Who was the first mate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tommy J. Hanson

options.text: That Mars natural satellites were actually captured asteroids

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Venice

questions.question: This novel centers around Florentino Arizas obsession with Fremina Daza who marries a wealthy doctor of medicine, named Juvenal Urbino.

options.text: Love in the Time of Cholera

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Love in the Time of Cholera

questions.question: Despite her long and tempestuous romance with Rhett Butler, the strong-willed Southern belle Scarlett OHara could not overcome her infatuation with this gentleman.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ashley Wilkes

questions.question: What type of rock is the white marble used to build the Taj Mahal?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Metamorphic

questions.question: According to Arthurian legend, Queen Guineveres love affair with this knight of the Round Table led to the downfall of Camelot.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lancelot

questions.question: What infection’s symptoms are tiny white-headed pimples, usually at the base of hair shafts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Folliculitis

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paris

questions.question: In which South American country can the Nazca Lines be found?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peru

questions.question: In 1986, this diamond found in a South African mine beat the record for the worlds largest faceted diamond.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Golden Jubilee

questions.question: What character uttered the following words by the end of Casablanca, one of the most enduring romantic dramas of all time: It doesnt take much to see that the problems of three little people dont amount to a hill of beans in this crazy world.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rick

questions.question: Which Canadian city is the site of the haunted Carleton County Jail, said to be the home of the ghost of Patrick Whelen, hanged for the murder of Thomas DArcy McGee?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ottawa, Ontario

questions.question: Two young women and an artist, who finds himself attracted to both of them, form one of the love triangles in this Woody Allen movie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vicky Cristina Barcelona

questions.question: Bamboo plants can grow up to 52 inches a day.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This author penned a novel centered around the mysterious Jay Gatsby who acquired an immense wealth in the hope of winning back his beloved, who married an old money millionaire, named Tom Buchanan.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scott Fitzgerald

questions.question: What trio of actors, playing characters involved in a love triangle, is not correctly matched with the movie?

options.text: The Notebook (2004) - Ryan Gosling, Rachel McAdams, James Marsden
The Graduate (1967) - Anne Bancroft, Dustin Hoffman, Katharine Ross
First Knight - Clive Owen, Keira Knightley, Sean Connery
The V.I.P.s (1963) - Elizabeth Taylor, Richard Burton, Louis Jourdan

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: First Knight - Clive Owen, Keira Knightley, Sean Connery

questions.question: By the end of what week does an unborn fetus start to develop fingerprints?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 18th

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Osborne

questions.question: This 1998 Independent film was also shot in Death Valley Junction, CA.  What is the correct name of the film?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Welcome to Serendipity

questions.question: In the Oscar-winning movie The English Patient, Geoffrey Cliftons wife, Kathrine, fell in love with Count de Almasy, the man who completely rejects nationalism and tries to erase all ties to countries. What was Almasys nationality?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hungarian

questions.question: In Adrian Lynes movie Unfaithful, Constance (Diane Lane), who is married to Edward (Richard Gere), has a fling with Paul (Olivier Martinez), a mysterious Frenchman who buys and sells used books. How does the movie end?

options.text: Constance and Edward confront each other and she subsequently commits suicide.
Constance discovers that Edward has killed Paul and tells him they will get through the crisis together.
Constance and Edward confront each other and she kills him.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Constance discovers that Edward has killed Paul and tells him they will get through the crisis together.

questions.question: A panther and a black leopard are the same animal.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bananas

questions.question: How many Earth years add up to a galactic year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 250 Million

questions.question: According to a study an office desk has nearly 400 times more bacteria than a bathroom toilet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The 1980s film, The Hitcher, starring Rutger Hauer and Jennifer Jason-Leigh, was shot in the same location as which other film?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Welcome to Serendipity

questions.question: What was used to help people hear before the hearing aid was invented?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ear Trumpet

questions.question: What is true about President Bill Clintons official portrait?

options.text: He is portrayed as being right-handed instead of left-handed.
It is the first official Presidential portrait painted by an African-American.
It is the first official Presidential portrait  not painted by an American citizen.
It is the first official Presidential portrait that had to be redone because of mistakes.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is the first official Presidential portrait painted by an African-American.
